review: The Positive: Works almost flawlessly with the iPhone apps it is designed to pair with... Hulu, Netflix, etc. are worlds easier to stream to my TV directly from my phone than using SmartTV functionality or a set-top "Smart TV Box."  I just open the Netflix app, indicate that I want it to show on my Chromecast (not my Phone or IPad) and hit play.  The Chromecast does the rest.  Note that Chromecast interacts directly with Netflix or other streaming services, so you do not need to keep the app open on your mobile device.  Once your media is streaming to the chromecast, you can close the app or continue navigating.  Also, streaming Chrome browser windows is very useful.The Negative: No Amazon Prime video makes it less useful than I'd like, however, you can circumvent this by streaming a chrome browser window from a PC or Mac, then playing amazon videos in the browser window. It's less convenient than with the native apps that it is designed for, but it wil still get the job done.The Verdict: For under 40$, I simplified my viewing experience, which I appreciate.  The downside is that I seem to be watching more and more netflix now as it has become just a matter of opening the app and streaming to my TV in seconds... Now I have to get back to Mad Men...
author: Peter
